Thus , the primary focus of the book is not Lexical Functional Grammar and especially not its formal aspects .With Bresnan ( 2001 ) this topic has been competently covered .Instead , the book shows how language data can be described and analyzed on the basis of few elementary assumptions derived from Lexical Functional Grammar ( e.g. lexical rules ) and a small set of simple formal notations which describe Argument Structure , Constituent Structure and Functional Structure .

Abstract .Traditionally , rich , constraint - based grammatical resources have been hand - coded .Scaling such resources beyond toy fragments to unrestricted , real text is knowledge - intensive , timeconsuming and expensive .The work reported in this thesis is part of a larger project to automate as much as possible the construction of wide - coverage , deep , constraint - based grammatical resources from treebanks .
